Generation I.Red: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.
Generation I.Yellow: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It will melt away and become invisible in water.
Generation I.Stadium: Found quietly resting by lake shores. Its cell structure is similar to water, so it can invisibly melt into water.

Generation II.Gold: When Vaporeon 's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
Generation II.Silver: It prefers beautiful shores. With cells similar to water molecules, it could melt in water.
Generation II.Crystal: As it uses the fins on the tip of its tail to swim, it blends with the water perfectly.
Generation II.Stadium 2: When Vaporeon 's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It prefers beautiful shores. With cells similar to water molecules, it could melt in water. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pok é mon has the ability to freely control water.
Generation III.Sapphire: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pok é mon has the ability to freely control water.

Generation VII.Sun: Its cells are composed of units much like water molecules. It lives close to water and is often mistaken for a mermaid.
Generation VII.Moon: Blending in with the water and erasing all signs of its presence, it patiently waits for its prey, fish Pokémon.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It detects nearby moisture with its fin. When its fin begins trembling rapidly, that means rain will fall in a few hours.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It melts into the water and becomes invisible.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It melts into the water and becomes invisible.

Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It has evolved to be suited for an aquatic life. It can become invisible when it melts away into water.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Tests show that its cells closely resemble water molecules, which perhaps explains its ability to conceal its form while submerged. I believe the origins of mermaid folklore lie with this Pokémon.
